results.title: Beloved
results.creator_credit: Elle Farnham, Daniel Zinkant, Suited & Booted Studios and First Light
results.brief_description: Through the main protagonist Dave, we hear and see what it is like to be in love and have those feelings trapped inside. As we are let into Dave’s world, we see him and a group of friends as they leave school and embark on their journey home. The film flicks between two worlds of fantasy and real-life as the journey progresses. As the narrative comes to an end, we watch the three friends depart and Dave is left alone. His love unknown, unsaid but only understood by the viewer.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Elle Farnham, Daniel Zinkant, Suited & Booted Studios and First Light

results.title: Pirates of the Indian Ocean
results.creator_credit: Omni Rahman, Enamul Khan, Rafi Rahman, Northamptonshire Bangladeshi Association, Wind & Foster Media and First Light
results.brief_description: Clumsy but lovable DJ duo Mankind and Small-Steps have built a devoted following to their pirate radio show. Raging against the machine in their own inimitable style, will they reach the top of radio programming or be caught on the wrong side of the law before they reach their dream?

results.title: The Box
results.creator_credit: Patrick Young, Felix Drake, Phoebe Flemming, eShed, Watershed and First Light
results.brief_description: This short drama is a tight observation of family life during the recession. Shot in a single living room, we see the ebb and flow of family life reflected in some pivotal moments through a particularly difficult time. However, the digital hearth remains a constant source of comfort.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Patrick Young, Felix Drake, Phoebe Flemming, eShed, Watershed and First Light

results.title: Hollywood Costume: Interview with Jan Chapman and Janet Patterson
results.creator_credit: Mike Kenneally, Csilla Csongvay, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description:
The 2009 film ‘Bright Star’ (directed by Jane Campion) tells the story of the romance between the English poet John Keats (1795 - 1821) and Fanny Brawne.
In this interview, ‘Bright Star’ producer Jan Chapman and costume designer Janet Patterson discuss the creative process behind costume design, and the design choices that went into making one of the costumes for the character Fanny Brawne (played in the film by Abbie Cornish).
The character’s crimson gown costume was on display during the ACMI Melbourne Winter Masterpieces ‘Hollywood Costume’ exhibition (2013).
Clips from ‘Bright Star’ (2009) courtesy of Hopscotch Films.

results.title: I've been everywhere
results.creator_credit: Rob Flisher, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Robert Flisher was excited to leave Australia and see the world as it was his childhood dream to join the Navy. Flisher opens up about his experiences with the Navy and talks about some of the exciting places he visited during his service.

results.title: A Life on the farm
results.creator_credit: Oz Sanderson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Oz Sanderson grew up on his farm with his two brothers during the Great Depression. His dad signed a consent form for him to join the army. While Oz was determined to serve as a pilot, the farm was always in his heart and he was more than happy to return to it after the war ended.

results.title: Survivor
results.creator_credit: Oz Phillips, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: At 18, Oswald enlisted in the Army through the Scotch College Cadet Force. He served in Darwin for two and a half years, surviving 76 raids, before training for inventory and being sent to Borneo to engage the Japanese. He can only recall the experience with “fear, fright and exhilaration”. Declared unfit for military service, he took some time to feel better again before marrying in 1950.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Oz Phillips, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

He can only recall the experience with “fear, fright and exhilaration”. Declared unfit for military service, he took some time to feel better again before marrying in 1950.

results.title: The St Arnaud boys
results.creator_credit: Norm Michael, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Norm started his life in the Army with six other local boys from his local area. He really enjoyed the mateship and sense of community he shared with them, and reminisces on the good times they had over the years. The mateship still lives on today when Norm catches up with them back in their home town, St Arnaud.

results.title: We kept them flying
results.creator_credit: Maude Coates, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: On the way home from enrolling in the Women’s Australian Auxiliary Air Force (WAAAF) in 1941, Maude Coates learnt that the Japanese forces had just bombed Darwin. For almost 4 years, Coates worked hard and built a great sense of companionship with the other women she lived and worked with. Serving time in the Women’s Forces out of duty, Maude feels proud to have served her country and been part of history.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Maude Coates, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
